HelpEntry.Text: The name of the stat. Only set these at the start, changing them later in development can cause issues.

Base Stats are your standard stat such as strength or intelligence. Resistance Stats are used in combat calculations to reduce damage taken. Vitality stats can change by themselves over time and cause actions such as death when reaching their min or max values.
The role of the stat. You can specify which stat is used for different combat calculations.
The value of the stat mobs have at level 0.
How much the stat goes up each level for mobs.
What percentage the stat increases per level for mobs.
The lowest value the stat can be. When the stat reaches this value the On Min Hit action is run.
The highest value the stat can be. When the stat reaches this value the On Max Hit action is run.
Does this stat only apply to players.
How much the stat changes each time the interval has passed.
How much the stat changes each time the interval has passed when it is in reverse.
How long in seconds before the stat changes its value again by the Shift Value.
Is the Shift Value/Reverse Value a percentage. If unticked it is a flat amount.
What happens when the stat gets down to the minimum value.
What happens when the stat reaches the maximum value.
What state the player/mob must have for this stat to update on the Shift Interval.
Should the requirement be set to True or False.
If the requirement isn't met, should the shift go into reverse mode.
